TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi sealed beforefieldinit ScriptingRoleServiceSection extends System.Configuration.ConfigurationSection

Docs.summary: Represents the configuration section for role-service settings.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingRoleServiceSection> class enables you to programmatically access and modify the `roleService` element of the configuration section for using AJAX functionality in [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)].
The role service is typically used to retrieve role information for the user who is logged on by using an asynchronous Web service call.
## Examples The following configuration file excerpt shows how to declaratively specify values for the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingRoleServiceSection.Enabled%2A> property of the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingRoleServiceSection> class.
``` <system.web.extensions> <scripting> <webServices> <roleService enabled="true" /> </webServices> </scripting> </system.web.extensions> ```
The following example shows how to access the <xref:System.Web.Configuration.ScriptingRoleServiceSection> element programmatically.
[!code-csharp[System.Web.Configuration#4](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Atlas/System.Web.Configuration/CS/App_Code/ConfigSectionSample.cs#4)] [!code-vb[System.Web.Configuration#4](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Atlas/System.Web.Configuration/VB/App_Code/ConfigSectionSample.vb#4)]

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the role service is enabled for an [!INCLUDE[vstecasp](~/includes/vstecasp-md.md)] application that uses AJAX features.
Docs.value: if the role service is enabled; otherwise, . The default is .
